themes: activation of vacant city properties for creative use
cross-sector collaboration between arts and other public systems
support for both short-term events and long-term cultural ecosystems
embedding artists as strategists within city departments
key_phrases: building a sustainable, visionary future for arts and culture
activate vacant, city-owned properties as creative and community space
funding and infrastructure that supports both one-time events and long-term, year-round cultural ecosystems
artist-in-residence program for every major public initiative
barriers_identified: lack of creative use of vacant city-owned properties
inadequate support for long-term cultural ecosystems
absence of artists embedded in city departments
solutions_proposed: activate vacant, city-owned properties as creative and community space
build cross-sector collaborations with housing, public health, transportation, and climate
design funding pipelines that embed artists in public systems
implement community-led marketing strategies co-created by artists and residents
develop funding and infrastructure for both one-time events and long-term ecosystems
offer more unrestricted funding to organizations
embed artists as cultural strategists or creative problem-solvers inside City departments
create an artist-in-residence program for every major public initiative
